alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 05 at 2:04PM PST until December 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT WILL EXPIRE AT 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...An extended period of sustained wave action is expected to continue through Wednesday morning as a series of fronts moves through the region, culminating in a period of very large breaking waves of 25 to 30 feet this afternoon into early Wednesday morning. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Large breaking waves will create hazardous conditions along and within the surf zone, and could inundate beaches and low lying shorelines. Beach erosion is possible, and exposed infrastructure may be damaged. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Stay away from the surf zone and off of jetties. Area beaches may become hazardous due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
